title: Linux lsof Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the powerful lsof command in Linux, learn how to identify open files by a process, and locate network connections. Gain practical system monitoring and management skills.

verify.name: Verify lsof command usage
verify.hint: Make sure you can run the `lsof` command without any arguments, as well as with the `-p` and `-u` options to filter the output.

steps.title: Identify Open Files by a Process

verify.name: Verify lsof by process
verify.hint: Make sure you can find the PID of the nginx process and use the `lsof -p` command to list its open files. Also, verify that you can list open files by the `labex` user.

verify.name: Verify lsof for network connections
verify.hint: Make sure you can use the `lsof -i` command to list all network connections, the `lsof -i TCP` command to list only TCP connections, and the `lsof -i -u labex` command to list connections for the `labex` user.
